javavis.base
Class JIPToolkit

java.lang.Object
  javavis.base.JIPToolkit

public final class JIPToolkit
extends java.lang.Object

Class to define basic methods to get and load AWT and JIP images. AWT images can be got with JIP images or with GIF o JPEG file directly. JIP images can get with AWT images or it can be a directly sequence of JIP files.

Method Detail

getAWTImage

public static java.awt.Image getAWTImage(JIPImage img,
                                         int b)
                                  throws JIPException
It gets an AWT image object from a band of a JIP image.

Parameters:
img - Source JIP image.
b - band number to extract (0 <= b <= numbands-1)
Returns:
AWT image result. AWT images are usually representing like color image , however, a band does not have color so the colors of a AWT image will be grey.
Throws:
JIPException

getAWTImage

public static java.awt.Image getAWTImage(JIPImage img)
                                  throws JIPException
It gets an AWT image object from a JIP image. If the JIP image is not COLOR type then it will be the image of the 0 band.

Parameters:
img - Source JIP image.
Returns:
AWT image.
Throws:
JIPException

getAWTImage

public static java.awt.Image getAWTImage(java.lang.String file)
It gets an AWT image object from a GIF or JPEG file. This method blocks the execution and it do not return the control until the new image is formed completely. Beside, we do not use the MediaTracker object to wait for the load of the image so this method uses MediaTracker internally.

Parameters:
file - Source file (It should be GIF or JPEG)
Returns:
AWT image result. (if can not load the image return null)

convertFromIntToDouble

public static double[][] convertFromIntToDouble(int[] src)
Converts an array of integer, containing an image to a 3 arrays of byte. This helps to separate a color coded in an integer, into three bytes: red, green, blue.

Parameters:
src - Array of integers
Returns:
Three array of bytes.

getColorImage

public static JIPImage getColorImage(java.awt.Image img)
                              throws JIPException
It gets a COLOR image object from a AWT image.

Parameters:
img - AWT image source
Returns:
JIP image result (tCOLOR type).
Throws:
JIPException

saveImageIntoFile

public static void saveImageIntoFile(JIPImage img,
                                     java.lang.String file)
                              throws JIPException
It saves a JIP image object in a JIP format file. The image is saved as a sequence

Parameters:
img - Image to save.
file - File where the image is saved (if it does not exist then it is created, else it is rewritten)
Throws:
JIPException

Parameters:

b - Band to extract.

Image in array form.

JIPException

                                 float[][] green,
                                 float[][] blue)
                          throws JIPException
It returns a color JIP image from 3 bands.

Parameters:
RED - Matrix which represents RED.
GREEN - Matrix which represents GREEN.
BLUE - Matrix which represents BLUE.
Returns:
JIP format image

JIPException

                                      java.lang.String file)
It saves a JIP sequence object in a JIP format file.

Parameters:
obj - Sequence to save.
file - File where the sequence is loaded (if it does not exist then it is created, else it is rewritten)

Parameters:
file - File where the sequence is loaded

Parameters:

saveImgIntoFileJpg

public static void saveImgIntoFileJpg(JIPSequence seq,
                                      int active,
                                      java.lang.String dir,
                                      java.lang.String namefile)
It saves a JPG image format.

Parameters:
seq: - Open a sequence in the screen which wants to save a copy in JPG format.
active: - Frame which is shown in the Gui window and it will be saved in a JPG format
dir: - Directory where the JPG image is saved.
namefile: - Name that the JPG format file will be saved.

                       throws JIPException
This method ask for a file. Depending of their type, it opens j2d, desktop or j3d applications

Parameters:
where - Directory where it starts to look for the file.

JIPException
